support_summary: Co-immunoprecipitation experiments revealed an abnormal interaction between mutant ATXN3 and CAMK2A in a mouse model of SCA3.

functions.cellular_process: In the pathological state of Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3 (SCA3), the mutant form of ATXN3, which contains a polyglutamine (polyQ) expansion, engages in abnormal protein interactions. One such interaction is with the Calcium/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II alpha (CAMK2A).
functions.effect_description: This aberrant interaction between mutant ATXN3 and CAMK2A is part of the formation of pathogenic protein complexes. These complexes are associated with defects in the axonal transport of mitochondria, which impairs mitochondrial motility and contributes to the neuronal dysfunction and degeneration observed in SCA3.
biological_consequence: Mutant ATXN3 with polyQ expansion abnormally interacts with CAMK2A → Pathogenic protein complexes are formed → Mitochondrial transport along axons is impaired → Neuronal dysfunction and degeneration in SCA3.
specific_effects: The interaction was identified via co-immunoprecipitation of ataxin-3 from brain lysates of a SCA3 knock-in mouse model (Ki150) with a long polyQ tract.
The protein complexes containing mutant ATXN3 and CAMK2A were linked to altered motility of mitochondria in the neurites of SCA3 Ki150 mice.

evidence.paper_title: Impaired interactions of ataxin-3 with protein complexes reveals their specific structure and functions in SCA3 Ki150 model
evidence.relevant_quote: Among others, mutant ataxin-3 abnormally interacted with subunits of large complexes such as Cct5 and 6, Tcp1, and Camk2a and Camk2b... The protein complexes were involved in transport of mitochondria in axons which was confirmed by altered motility of mitochondria along SCA3 Ki150 neurites.

mechanism: In the pathological state of Spinocerebellar Ataxia Type 3 (SCA3), the mutant form of ATXN3, which contains a polyglutamine (polyQ) expansion, engages in abnormal protein interactions. One such interaction is with the Calcium/calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II alpha (CAMK2A).
effect: This aberrant interaction between mutant ATXN3 and CAMK2A is part of the formation of pathogenic protein complexes. These complexes are associated with defects in the axonal transport of mitochondria, which impairs mitochondrial motility and contributes to the neuronal dysfunction and degeneration observed in SCA3.
summary: ATXN3 interacts with CAMK2A to modulate mitochondrial axonal transport (pathological), ultimately affecting neuronal dysfunction and degeneration in sca3.

evidence.paper_title: Impaired interactions of ataxin-3 with protein complexes reveals their specific structure and functions in SCA3 Ki150 model
evidence.relevant_quote: Among others, mutant ataxin-3 abnormally interacted with subunits of large complexes such as Cct5 and 6, Tcp1, and Camk2a and Camk2b... The protein complexes were involved in transport of mitochondria in axons which was confirmed by altered motility of mitochondria along SCA3 Ki150 neurites.
